chunks.Text: Let's solve one problem based on multiple transformations of continuous time signals.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: In this problem we need to plot the signal yt which is equal to 3x 2t plus 3.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: Plot of signal xt is already given in the problem and by using this plot we need to

chunks.Text: plot the signal yt.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: And if you remember the last presentation we obtained the priority order for various

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: operations on continuous time signals.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The first priority is given to time reversal.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: So the first thing we have to do is to reverse the time.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The second priority is given to time shifting.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: After time reversal we have to shift the time.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The third priority is given to time scaling and we can perform amplitude scaling at any

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: time.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: I will perform amplitude scaling after time scaling.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: So amplitude scaling is the last operation.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: You can also perform amplitude scaling before time reversal.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: Now we will move to the solution of this problem.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: You can see yt is not having negative t so there is no need to perform the time reversal

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: and we will start with time shifting.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The original signal is xt and now we will perform the time shifting.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The time shifting with small k equal to 3 because we are adding 3 to the time.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: So the new signal is xt plus 3 and we have to plot the waveform of the signal xt plus

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: Here k is positive.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: This means this is the case of time advance and we will get everything 3 seconds early.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: So in place of minus 1 we will have minus 4, minus 4 and in place of 3 we will have

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The amplitude will remain same in case of time shifting.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The amplitude is equal to 1 in case of signal xt so we will have amplitude equal to 1 in

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: case of signal xt plus 3.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: So this is the waveform of this signal and now we will perform the time scaling.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The signal is xt plus 3 and we will perform the time scaling with alpha equal to 2 because

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: we are multiplying 2 to the time so the new signal is xt plus 3 and in case of time scaling

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: we have to divide alpha t axis by alpha.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: Alpha is equal to 2 so we will divide minus 4 by 2 and 0 by 2.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: This will give us minus 2 and 0.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: The amplitude will remain same which is equal to 1.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: So we have 1 as the amplitude.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: In case of signal x2t plus 3 this is the plot of signal x2t plus 3.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)

chunks.Text: The last operation is amplitude scaling and if you see the expression of yt you will find

chunks.Text: So x2t plus 3 is what we have as the original signal in this last case and we will perform

chunks.Text: After this we will have 3x2t plus 3.

chunks.Text: In case of amplitude scaling there will be change in the amplitude but time will remain

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: same so we have minus 2, 0 and in place of 1 we will have 3 because 1 multiplied by 3

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: is equal to 3 so this is the amplitude of the final signal and it is equal to 3.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: Now we will analyze all these waveforms.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: In first operation we have time advance because k is positive and you can see the whole waveform

chunks.Text: is shifted to the left.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: So this case is also called as left shifting.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: In the second operation we perform time scaling and you can see alpha is greater than 1.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: This means this is the case of compression and if you compare these two signals you will

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: find this signal is compressed.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: In the last operation in case of amplitude scaling beta is equal to 3 which is greater

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: than 1 and when beta is greater than 1 we have the amplification.

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: Comparing the two signals we can clearly see there is amplification or increment in the

chunks.Title: Multiple Transformations of CTS (Solved Problem 1)
chunks.Text: amplitude so this is all for this lecture.
